MechSim.Graphics
Class TransformedImage

java.lang.Object
  MechSim.Graphics.TransformedImage
All Implemented Interfaces:
ImageObserver, SelfRendering
public final class TransformedImage
extends Object
implements SelfRendering, ImageObserver

Renders an image that can be scaled, rotated and/or translated

Author:
Gurwinder Gulati

Constructor Detail

TransformedImage

public TransformedImage(Image img)
Renders an image that can be scaled, rotated and/or translated

Parameters:
img - Image to be transformed; can be null
Method Detail

SetTranslation

public boolean SetTranslation(double x,
                              double y)
Translates the image by a certain amount when the image is rendered.

Parameters:
x - Pixels in the x-axis to translate by
y - Pixels in the y-axis to translate by
Returns:
Whether or not the operation was successful

Translate

public void Translate(double xDelta,
                      double yDelta)
Adjusts the current translate of the image by a certain amount.

Parameters:
xDelta - Change in x translation, in pixels
yDelta - Change in y translation, in pixels

SetRotation

public boolean SetRotation(double rotation)
Rotates the image by a certain amount when the image is rendered. The image is always rotated about the origin.

Parameters:
rotation - Rotation in radiians (clockwise)
Returns:
Whether or not the operation was successful

Rotate

public void Rotate(double rotation)
Rotates the current image clockwise

Parameters:
rotation - Rotation in radiians (clockwise)

SetOrigin

public boolean SetOrigin(double originX,
                         double originY)
Sets the origin of the image. The image is always rotated about the origin.

Parameters:
originX - X-position of the origin in pixels, where 0 is the left edge of the image
originY - Y-position of the origin in pixels, where 0 is the top edge of the image
Returns:
Whether or not the operation was successful

SetScalar

public boolean SetScalar(double scaleX,
                         double scaleY)
Sets the scalar of the image. They determine how much the image is "stretched" while being drawn.

Parameters:
scaleX - Scale in the x-axis, where 1 is the original image width and 2 is twice the width
scaleY - Scale in the y-axis, where 1 is the original image height and 2 is twice the height
Returns:
Whether or not the operation was successful

GetOriginX

public double GetOriginX()
Returns:
Origin of the image in the x-axis, where 0 is the left edge of the image

GetOriginY

public double GetOriginY()
Returns:
Origin of the image in the y-axis, where 0 is the top edge of the image

GetScaleX

public double GetScaleX()
Returns:
Amount the image is scaled in the X-dimension, where 1 is the original image width and 2 is twice the width

GetScaleY

public double GetScaleY()
Returns:
Amount the image is scaled in the Y-dimension, where 1 is the original image height and 2 is twice the height

GetRotation

public double GetRotation()
Returns:
Amount the image is rotated clockwise, in radiians

GetTranslationX

public double GetTranslationX()
Returns:
Amount the image is moved from (0, 0) in screen coordinates in the X direction (right)

GetTranslationY

public double GetTranslationY()
Returns:
Amount the image is moved from (0, 0) in screen coordinates in the Y direction (down)

Render

                   ImageObserver renderer)
Description copied from interface: SelfRendering
Renders itself

Specified by:
Render in interface SelfRendering
Parameters:
g - Graphics2D used to draw the resource
